title: Can I make money from lyrics videos on YouTube? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes! you can make money by making lyrics video on you tube. But make sure, not to get involved in copyright issues. There are few ways you can prevent the problem to some extent. Before going to that let us understand how will you tube take action against you. So now let us suppose you have the channel and you have already started making money. Now if any of the owner of the music that you have uploaded in your channel claims copyright, you tube will verify if it was your original or not. Which in your case they will find negative, so you tube will take down that video and issue warning to you. Three warnings in 3 months may lead to suspension of your channel. So the point here is if some how the owner is not claiming copyright you will never be in trouble. Therefore you must focus on ways you can avoid those issues. You may try following : Never forget to mention who the music belongs to, that is to say you must give credit to the owner of the music.If in case you tube issues warning you can contact the owner of the music and request them to take down the claim on certain terms and condition.Usually if you agree to share the income the owners wont have much problem.Try to give link to the original video in the description.Try to include disclaimer in the start of the video, provide proper information of the owner of the music.Or you may not want to monetize those videos which you think may get copyright claims, in this way you can always increase the number of traffic to your channelOnce your subscribers increase slowly start uploading your genuine videos, which will surely help you make moneyAnd lastly i would recommend watching videos and reading more about the topic.Once you become you tuber you shall come to know a lot many ways out. But in the very first place start something. GOOD LUCK!!

You sure can. Without a doubt. Say you start a channel or you already have a channel. You take popular music videos, put them into a software where you can create videos and edit the content e.g Power Director, Final Cut and if you want to get real technical the Adobe Premiere Pro CC, Apple Final Cut Pro X Apple iMovie (for Mac OS X)Corel VideoStudio Ultimate X10 etc etc But you won't need that for what you want to do. Just use a simple one that is free for the computer you use. Anyway import the video in, and start familiarising yourself with the editing tools. Find the title or subtitle function and start putting lyrics into every segment of the song you chose. when you’re done save and export your video and upload to YouTube. You can make money from this for sure because people are always going to search for videos with lyrics so they can sing along etc. So that is the watered down version of how to do it but if you make hundred of videos with lyrics to peoples favourite songs, with subscribers and views etc sooner or later Youtube will come knocking. Edit: I forgot to add, you don't need the video, you can use a background from the video editing software and just import the audio. Then add the lyrics against a background:) Which might be easier. All the very best!

Yes, but only if you invest money to buy a commercial license for the use of that music. You can't just go ahead and make money out of other people's work. Songs are copyrighted and you must obtain a commercial license if you want to use someone's song in your video and make money out of it. And if it's a popular song, such a license can easily cost you hundreds of dollars per video. So you'll have to ask yourself if it's really worth it. What usually happens if you use a copyrighted song, is that YouTube either strikes the video, or gives all the ad revenue to the copyright owner. That's what happens to most of the lyrics videos out there. The only exception is Creative Commons music that's licensed for commercial use. Jamendo is a good place to find music like that. But I'm guessing you want to go for music that people actually know, right?

You are asking the wrong question. I suggest you to ask me the following question: Can I make money from lyrics videos on YouTube with an initial investment of $X? Anybody can open a burger chain but not everybody can survive for three years and expand into other territories. If you have $100,000 then you it will be almost impossible to beat McDonald's. If you have $1,000,000 then it will be a lot easier because you can hire people like me with a lot of experience and successfully run your chain of restaurants. If you have $10,000,000 then you can file for an IPO in a few years and make billions like Shake Shack, The Habit, El Pollo Loco and others. It takes money to make money, you know.

The prior respondent is not only incorrect, but totally out of touch where knowledge of current monetization policy is concerned. Lyrics videos are typically generated for copyrighted popular commercial music. Without a valid sync license, such videos infringe multiple copyrights. Attempted monetization of unlicensed copyright content is both a Terms of Service, channel monetization policy and Google Publisher Policy violation. Then there is the fact that as you are neither the instrumental composer, or lyricist of the song, it would be Reused Content under YouTube’s channel monetization policies. Finally scrolling or slideshow display of text on screen would be Repetitious Content under current monetization policy. You can no longer monetize lyrics videos on YouTube.

hi there  Yes you can create money with you tube with you tube monetization.  You tube monetization is allowing you tube to play ads on your you tube channel. But for that you need to have unique videos which can include anything like music videos, videos including lyrics, Home made videos about any thing, or so on. Keep one thing in mind that video that you are going to place on your you tube channel must not be copyrighted by anyone , That should be created or filmed by you only. The more you get subscriber the more views you will get and the more money you will earn.

Yes, if you get a commercial license to the use of that music. If you don't have the license and you make video you will get copyright claim. If you want to do so then use non copyrighted music or get a license to use copyrighted music
With their permission, sure. Otherwise, using their lyrics (or any other content) is illegal copyright infringement. Whether or not you are making money.
